comment.author: 59437419@N02
comment._content: Where in Pemba is this?  Is it still there?

comment.author: 59437419@N02
comment._content: Just realised this is in the Mozambique island of Pemba, not the Tanzania/Zanzibar one.  So it should not appear under "Zanzibar".

comment.author: 78505398@N07
comment._content: This is NOT Pemba Zanzibar NOR is it Mozambique.  Not African at all.  It is somewhere in India or SE Asia.

comment.author: 24513957@N06
comment._content: Yes, is India, near Mumbay, Elephanta Island Temple, I been there. www.flickr.com/photos/terratripper/2414154898/

comment.author: 46273880@N00
comment._content: This is shrine inside the main cave at the Elephanta Caves complex on the island off Mumbai harbour. This main cave, "Cave number 1" has this image of Shiva [http://www.flickr.com/photos/adzone/4604676686/] The shrine is dedicated to Shiva and the human figures (damaged) are called dvarpalas (gatekeepers) in the temple art tradition. This is a photograph posted on the website of the Archaeological Survey of India asi.nic.in/images/wh_elephanta/pages/025.html (The map is still showing Pemba, Mozambique)
